result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda F. Fox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/school.

Assessment, counseling, treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Jail credit applies if revoked. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: FTE, school or combination of the two, and if so not engaged 8 hours of community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

AODA and follow up.  Outpatient treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Becky.
Case called: 9:46 am
INCLUDES 14CF718, 14CF435, 15CF435, 15CF844, 15CF848
State appears by ADA K. Mayo; Def appears in custody with Atty Julie Sawyer; & Robin Kennedy;

PRELIMINARY HEARING in 15CF848
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA & SENTENCING in 15CF435, 15CF844 & 15CF848
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed;  VRCW; Victim Impact Statement filed;
State moves to:
15CF844> D&RI ENTIRE FILE
15CF435
Ct 2 Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>D&RI
15CF848
Ct 1 (BJ/Felony/Repeater)>D&RI
Ct 3 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>D&RI
Ct 4 (Resisting/Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>D&RI
Ct 5 (Receiving/Concealing Stolen Property/Repeater)>D&RI
Ct 6 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take/Repeater)>D&RI
Ct 7 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take/Repeater)>D&RI
Ct 8 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>D&RI
COURT GRANTS

PLEA: 
15CF435
Ct 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater)>GUILTY
15CF848
Ct 2 (Misappropriate ID/Repeater)>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 5 1/2 YEARS PRISON TOTAL on each count> (2 1/2 yrs IC & 3 years ES) to run CONCURRENT with all other sentences: CONDITIONS:  Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so engaged 8 hrs CS per week; AODA & Follow up; outpatient treatment; Absolute Sobriety; DNA sample & surcharge; CC
COURT notes Deft has 81 days jail credit in 15CF848 & 142 days jail credit in 15CF435; Deft qualifies for programming.

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 14CF718 (Count 1 & 2) & 14CF435 (Count 1)
COURT ORDERS: 3 1/2 YEARS PRISON TOTAL on each count> (18 Months I/C & 2 years ES) to run CONCURRENT with all other sentences: CONDITIONS: Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as Deemed appropriate by agent; FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so engaged 8 hrs CS per week; AODA & Follow up; outpatient treatment; Absolute Sobriety; CC;
COURT notes DNA sample and surchage does not apply & Deft is entitled to 173 days credit in 14CF435; Deft qualifies for programming.
Adj: 10:08 am
Julie Sawyer

Case Called: 1:06
Includes: 14CF435 and 14CF718
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard.  Def appears with Atty Kathryn Jackan.
Waiver of Prelim filed in each case, Defendant understands and waives the prelim voluntarily, Information will be filed later today.
The Information will mirror the complaint in 14CF435 and in 14CF718 Count 1 will be AMENDED to delete the PTAC enhancer and the other charges will remain the same. State will have 24 hours to file.
Defendant wishes to proceed to sentencing today.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to:14CF718>>Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5>>DRI
Court grants.
PLEA: 14CF435>>Count 1>>Possession of Narcotic Drugs>>No Contest
14CF718>>Amended Count 1>>Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/Repeater>>No Contest
Count 2>>Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater>>No Contest
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: WS; Probation for 4 years (concurrent) with Conditions of: Assessment, Counseling, Treatment including an AODA and follow thru deemed appropriate by agent, CC (including new charges in 14CF718), absolute sobriety, good faith effort to maintain FTE/School, 40 hrs of CS, DNA sample and surcharge. 14CF718 has 30 days of credit if revoked. 14CF435 has 1 day credit if revoked.
Adj: 1:24
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 4, 2014 at 09:15 am.
